TopicTitle: What's your most euphoric KSP moment?

Articles.Content: Mine was when I finally could play the thing after multiple hours of confusing payment stuff.

I don’t think I’ve ever had one tbh. KSP tends to trigger frustration and depression when I play.

 

Edited May 10, 2021 by Guest
Inappropriate content

My first fully solo rendezvous and docking gets that award.

With my first 'non Kerbin' landing (Mun) in second, although I did achieve it a long time before the docking.

My first Mun landing, no question. One of my all-time peak gaming moments.

Jeb returned to make a soft landing, then rolled down a mountainside and died in a ball of fire. One of my first questions here was, “does this happen often and how do I avoid it?”

First and only time I landed my fist stage booster exactly back on the launchpad, Falcon9 style, without the help of mods (landing legs are mod parts though).

Usually I am happy if I land within a few km of the KSC. When I started out with this I was happy when I hit the peninsula.
For me i think it would be when i got to duna lowlands.

Rendezvous and docking - by hand.

 

Even though I can do it while watching TV, now, I still get satisfaction from it every time.
